greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=1} (phi - c(2*n-1)), where phi is the golden ratio (A001622), and c are the convergents to phi.
comment: Define the lower deviance of x > 0 by dL(x) = Sum_{n>=1} (x - c(2*n-1,x)), where c(k,x) = k-th convergent to x. The greatest lower deviance occurs when x = golden ratio, so that this constant is the absolute maximal lower deviance.
formula: Equals Sum_{k>=1} 1/(phi^(2*k-1) * F(2*k-1)), where F(k) is the k-th Fibonacci number (A000045). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 05 2020
example: The convergents to x are c(1) = 1, c(2) = 2, c(3) = 3/2, c(4) = 5/3, ..., so that
mathematica: x = GoldenRatio; z = 600; c = Convergents[x, z];
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 06 2015
